name: sfchronicle
text: SF author Dave Eggers curates benefit album of indie rock rarities, available for 24 hours only. Story by @MusicSF: https://t.co/A4DMBOIL8v

name: sfchronicle
text:
SFPD officers and other city employees have been able to use a dozen gyms during the pandemic, mostly inside police stations, despite the fact that private gyms have been closed to the public for the past several months.

Story by @TrishaThadani: https://t.co/dHfC6ODaoB

name: sfchronicle
text: Pac-12 said it has partnered with a diagnostic test company to establish daily rapid-results coronavirus testing of student-athletes across its campuses, a "major step toward the safe resumption of Pac-12 sport," commissioner Larry Scott said. https://t.co/54zlBOh4wX

name: sfchronicle
text: Though the last 40 seconds of her grandson’s life have been seen widely, Addie Kitchen said she wants #StevenTaylor to be known for who he was during the rest of his 33 years — a lovable goofball and aspiring rapper with 3 kids and a large extended family. https://t.co/xNhSioRLgX

name: sfchronicle
text: One of the Bay Area’s popular new pandemic-born food pop-ups has been shut down by Alameda County’s health department after “a neighbor” reported her illegal operation. Is tolerance for these pop-up operations waning? https://t.co/4Ildmb7Dgj

name: sfchronicle
text: Megafires sparked last month constitute three of the top four largest wildfires in modern state history. The SCU Lightning Complex (391,578 acres) is No. 2. The LNU Lightning Complex (375,209 acres) is No. 3. The August Complex (287,106 acres) is No. 4. https://t.co/N2KH0zkQ4t

name: sfchronicle
text: From @JustMrPhillips: While white people have the choice of opting out of the country’s racial awakening, it’s worth remembering that Black suffering drives Black activism, which is why we’re seeing so much of it. https://t.co/SUICwwQLh9

name: sfchronicle
text: Complimentary tickets to the advance screening of ‘All In: The Fight for Democracy’ at the West Wind Capitol Drive-In are available to Chronicle Members for Wednesday, September 9, 2020. Click here for more information: https://t.co/92xWL82Kwe

name: sfchronicle
text: It was front-page news when incumbent President Ronald Reagan kicked off his fall re-election campaign on Sept. 3, 1984, with a Labor Day rally at De Anza College in Cupertino. https://t.co/WT6DAxRerH

text: Here’s an update on conditions at popular destinations across the Bay Area and Northern California. https://t.co/CSyqVmQ7SP

text:
The risks to our water caused by wildfires, calls grow for S.F. health official's ouster, and expect a long hot weekend.

name: sfchronicle
text:
Like Santa Rosa and Paradise before it, the small community in the Santa Cruz Mountains is trying to figure out whether its water system was contaminated by wildfire.
https://t.co/Ahn5nQaNrg

name: sfchronicle
text:
The blazes sparked last month and still burning in Northern California now constitute three of the top four largest wildfires in modern state history, Cal Fire reports. Follow our live updates for the latest: 
https://t.co/gw5zK8I3Q7

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Chabot Science and Space Center is auctioning off a personal planetarium show as part of its effort to make up some of its losses from the pandemic, marketing a romantic dinner for two under the stars.
https://t.co/B1nTQw3w5X

name: sfchronicle
text: Welcome to entertaining in 2020. Your typical gathering or backyard BBQ likely looks much different today than it did last summer — if it happens at all. https://t.co/futxyz4J2S

name: sfchronicle
text: During coronavirus, tip like your life — or someone else’s — depends on it, writes @hooleil: https://t.co/LNtTKfDmb8
